title: The electric air taxi that could take you from London to Manchester in an hour starting in 2025
text:
According to the laws of physics, the electric aircraft made by German company Lilium looks like it shouldn’t be able to fly.

With no thrust, no visible rotors and no runway, the five-seater electric taxi appears to simply lift straight up off the ground before completing a perfect circle, controlled from the ground, and landing again.

"A lot of people have said: ‘Can it fly forward, can it actually do these things?’,” says chief executive Daniel Wiegand.

“Now we're giving an update from the flight testing, and basically telling the world that the aircraft has achieved these milestones, it has performed as it should. It's flying forward, it's climbing, it's flying circles.”

This might not sound...
description: According to the laws of physics, the electric aircraft made by German company Lilium looks like it shouldn’t be able to fly.
